books.title: A Christmas Carol
books.author: Charles Dickens
books.summary: A miserly moneylender is visited by four ghosts who help him see how to honor Christmas in his heart all year round.

books.title: Pimpernel and Rosemary
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A famous journalist is drawn into the intrigues of two Eastern European nations in the aftermath of World War I.

books.title: The Autobiography of an Idea
books.author: Louis H. Sullivan
books.summary: Famed architect Louis H. Sullivan recounts his life and career.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Wind in the Willows
books.author: Kenneth Grahame
books.summary: Four animals adventure through the bucolic English countryside.

books.title: Brewster’s Millions
books.author: George Barr McCutcheon
books.summary: A young man stands to gain a fortune—but only if he loses one first.

books.title: Titus Andronicus
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A blood feud erupts between a famous Roman general and the Queen of the Goths.

books.title: The Lost Continent
books.author: C. J. Cutcliffe Hyne
books.summary: A swashbuckling adventure on the fabled continent of Atlantis.

books.title: William—An Englishman
books.author: Cicely Hamilton
books.summary: A young activist couple’s lives turn for the worse when the unexpected arrival of foreign soldiers interrupts their honeymoon.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: M. R. James
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories written by M. R. James.

books.title: The Life of Buffalo Bill
books.author: William F. Cody
books.summary: The 1879 autobiography of William F. Cody, more commonly known as Buffalo Bill, detailing his early life in the American West.

books.title: The Mystery of the Yellow Room
books.author: Gaston Leroux
books.summary: A young reporter struggles to investigate a seemingly impossible crime, in which an assailant has escaped from a locked bedroom completely unseen.

books.title: Bashan and I
books.author: Thomas Mann
books.summary: A renowned novelist describes the unique relation that links him to his dog.

books.title: Nicomachean Ethics
books.author: Aristotle
books.summary: Aristotle examines how one may live in the most thriving, excellent manner.

books.title: Sonnets from the Portuguese
books.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
books.summary: A collection of 44 love sonnets.

books.title: Where Angels Fear to Tread
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: After an English widow on holiday impetuously falls in love with a handsome young Tuscan, her panicked in-laws send a rescue party.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A collection of Fritz Leiber short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Jungle Book
books.author: Rudyard Kipling
books.summary: Seven fable-like tales about jungle animals in India and the humans who live on the edges of their realm.

books.title: Siddhartha
books.author: Hermann Hesse
books.summary: A man embarks on a spiritual journey through India.

books.title: The Innocents Abroad
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain travels abroad, offering witty observations on the places and cultures he encounters and commentary on the habits and foibles of his fellow travelers.
